conversation.content: [shaky voice] God, I can't—I mean, we actually got them out. All of them. The whole family. [pause] My hands are still, like, trembling from working the controls. You know, twenty years I've been operating excavators, but this was—[exhale deeply] this was different. Really different. When I saw that little girl's face through the gap we made, I just... [sigh] The dad was holding the ceiling beam up with his bare hands—I don't even know how he had the strength, honestly. And, um, the precision needed to not cause another collapse while pulling debris... [anxious] one wrong move with that bucket and the whole thing could've—anyway, we got them. [relieved] That's what matters, right? The mom, she was protecting the baby the entire time, just curled around him. [voice breaking] Six hours they were under there. Six. [pause] I keep thinking about, like, what if I'd moved too fast or, you know, miscalculated the load? But my crew, they were—[grateful] everyone was incredible. The way we all just worked together. [emotional] That family is going home tonight because of what we did. [sniffle] I think I need to, uh, just sit here for a minute. Let it sink in. We saved them. We actually saved them.
